parameters.name: s
parameters.description:
A socket that's been created with
  socket().

parameters.name: addr
parameters.description:
A result parameter that's filled in with the address of the connecting entity,
      as known to the communications layer. 
      The exact format of the addr parameter is determined by 
      the domain in which the connection was made.

parameters.name: addrlen
parameters.description:
A value-result parameter.
      It should initially contain the amount of space pointed to by addr; 
      on return it contains the actual length (in bytes) of the address returned. 
      This call is used with connection-based socket types, currently with SOCK_STREAM.

full_content:
Function: accept
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/accept.html
Synopsis: int accept( int s,
Headers: #include <sys/types.h>, #include <sys/socket.h>
Parameters:
  - s: A socket that's been created with
  socket().
  - addr: A result parameter that's filled in with the address of the connecting entity,
      as known to the communications layer. 
      The exact format of the addr parameter is determined by 
      the domain in which the connection was made.
  - addrlen: A value-result parameter.
      It should initially contain the amount of space pointed to by addr; 
      on return it contains the actual length (in bytes) of the address returned. 
      This call is used with connection-based socket types, currently with SOCK_STREAM.
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <sys/types.h>
#include <sys/socket.h>

int accept( int s,
            struct sockaddr * addr,
            socklen_t * addrlen );
